The Museum of Fine Arts in Houston (MFA) has appointed Leslie Cook, the museum’s curator of modern and contemporary art, as its next executive director. She succeeds Peter W. Downs, who retired June 30 after a decade at the helm of the institution.“I’ve been honored to serve as the MFA’s interim executive director for the past three years, and I’m eager to continue to shape the museum’s mission and work with artists and communities across Texas,” said Cook, who will take up the post on July 1. “I’m excited to work with the MFA’s board to help the museum organize a diverse and exciting exhibition program that highlights contemporary art and explores contemporary issues through the themes of American history, climate change, the legacy of African American art, and the legacy of the African diaspora.”Prior to joining the MFA, Cook served as the curator of large-scale installation at Southern Exposure, an artist’s colony in New Orleans, and worked as a curator at the Museum of Modern Art in New York from 2004 to 2015.
